main event: Three objects were observed in the sky over New York on May 2, 1959, including a tear-drop shaped shining object, a squarish/round bluish-white object, and an object tracked on radar.
interesting points: The tear-drop shaped object disappeared with darkness and was observed for 45 minutes.
The squarish/round bluish-white object was the size of a silver dollar and moved in a southwesterly direction, observed for 30 minutes.
The radar tracked an object with no logical sequence of movement, but mostly within a 35 nautical mile radius of Bradley Field, with a permanent fade-out after 1 hour and 8 minutes.
The pilot indicated the object was moving generally southeast.
The ATIC concluded the object was probably a balloon, based on the reported wind velocity and the object's movement further east over time.
sighted object: Three objects - a tear-drop shaped shining object, a squarish/round bluish-white object, and an object tracked on radar
witnesses: Civilian, FAA controller, and radar operators
